summary: This is an internal email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing the autopsy report of Jeffrey Epstein and their coordination with the NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME). The emails detail the OCME's plan to release a redacted autopsy report to Epstein's brother, the sensitive materials the prosecutors requested be redacted (including an FBI 302 and names of prison guards), and mention a handwritten note found in Epstein's cell.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.role: Next of kin of Jeffrey Epstein

connections.description: Mark Epstein is identified as Jeffrey Epstein's brother and next of kin.
Lt. I= was a prison guard on duty at the MCC at the time Jeffrey Epstein's body was found and was interviewed as a witness.

events.title: Planned submission of proposed redactions to OCME
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office plans to provide their proposed redactions for the Epstein autopsy report to the NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The OCME conducted an autopsy and concluded the cause of death was suicide.

locations: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME), New York City
keyFacts: The NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) completed a full autopsy report on Jeffrey Epstein, concluding his death was a suicide.

The U.S. Attorney's Office requested OCME redact sensitive materials from the autopsy report before releasing it to Epstein's brother, Mark Epstein, including an FBI 302 interview of a key MCC witness (Lt. I=) and the names of prison guards under investigation.
A handwritten note listing grievances about MCC conditions was found in Epstein's cell at the time of his death, but it was assessed by OCME and prosecutors as not being a suicide note.
